title: This song I'm writing sounds really good, but one of the lyrics has a bit of a dirty meaning and I didn't realize. Should I keep it or change it? - Quora

response.answer_text: Keep it. You can always give your version of what those questionable words were intended to mean. Gi with it and follow up with us here. Would every interested in seeing how this progresses. Your welcome to run these specific words in the specific line of the song by me for further understanding and research by me. As a writer and wanna be lyricist I can be if help. I am extending an invitation to you for my analysis and further recommendations based on both my opinion and the possibility of censorship. You can reply here but would prefer your reply to an e-mail address that I use for my secure reading, writing, and blogging. You will need to provide a confirmation code before I respond with a contact address. thanks, Sincerely Ron S.

You could try to find a different way to phrase it if it sounds dirty but isn’t supposed to be. …If you wanna keep it in, that’s fine, too. It all depends on what you want to do. It’s your song, after all. If you think it sounds good, keep it. If you think you should change it, go ahead.
